name: J. P. Kayser & Sohn
biography: Kayserzinn (1894-1925) was made by one of the most successful firms to produced Art Nouveau pewter ware during the turn of the twentieth century. It was a family-run factory "J.P. Kayser Sohn", and they produced other wares using Kayser & Sohn as a mark, but gave a specific name for the pewter “Kayserzinn”, perhaps a play on the idea that it could be the Kaiser’s –or Emperor’s-pewter. In 1894 Engelbert Kayser set up a design workshop that supplied around 800 different designs that were produced by the Krefeld, Germany, factory.
